newsitem.title: UK: London clean tanker report - Mideast stays steady.
newsitem.headline: London clean tanker report - Mideast stays steady.

text.p: Clean tanker rates in most major lifting sectors on Friday held steady in thin activity, brokers said.
Middle East activity was lacklustre with rates on 55,000 tonners to Japan settling at W167.5.
Brokers said the market was generally slow and they expected rates to remain flat until mid-September.
No 70,000 tonners were fixed though Mitsubishi took one of two vessels to Japan on the 55,000 tonner Sitamona.
There were a dearth of fixtures in the Mediterranean/Black Sea region.
Demand in the UK/Continent for 20,000 tonners was extremely thin, brokers said.
"It's been quieter on the smaller ships. We've only seen activity involving a 60,000 tonne cargo," said one broker.
Rates remained at W195, but brokers said there was an underlying strength in the market amid a perceived lack of tonnage.
Brokers said rates in the Caribbean up the U.S coast had fallen. Vessels carrying 30,000 tonne cargoes slipped 15 Worldscale points to W225.
